intro: Cerastium arvense var. tatrae, commonly known as the Tatra mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Tatra Mountains in Central Europe. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems covered with fine, hairy hairs. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and covered with a dense layer of fine pubescence. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
